Option A: It supports the usual declaration of primitive data types
Option B: It doesn’t support all types of inheritance

Question: Which concept of OOP is false for C++?
Option A: Code can be written without using classes
Option B: Code must contain at least one class
Option C: A class must have member functions
Option D: At least one object should be declared in code
Answer: Code can be written without using classes

Question: Which header file is required in C++ to use OOP?

Answer: OOP can be used without using any header file
